description: Extraordinary Circumstances screening criteria per FSH 1909.15 Chapter 30

circumstances.name: Federally Listed Species
circumstances.description: May adversely affect threatened, endangered, or proposed species or their critical habitat
screening_questions: Are federally listed species present in the project area?
Does the project affect designated critical habitat?
Could the action adversely affect listed species?

circumstances.name: Flood Plains, Wetlands, or Municipal Watersheds
circumstances.description: May have significant adverse effect on flood plains, wetlands, or municipal watersheds
screening_questions: Are flood plains or wetlands present?
Would the action significantly affect water quality?
Is the area a municipal watershed?

circumstances.name: Congressionally Designated Areas
circumstances.description: May have significant adverse effect on congressionally designated areas (wilderness, wild and scenic rivers, national monuments)
screening_questions: Are wilderness areas within or adjacent to project area?
Would the action affect wilderness characteristics?
Are wild and scenic rivers present?

circumstances.name: Inventoried Roadless Areas
circumstances.description: May have significant adverse effect on inventoried roadless areas
screening_questions: Is the project in an inventoried roadless area?
Would the action affect roadless characteristics?
Does the 2001 Roadless Rule apply?

circumstances.name: Research Natural Areas
circumstances.description: May establish precedent for future action or represent decision in principle about future actions with significant environmental effects
screening_questions: Would this action set precedent for future decisions?
Are research natural areas affected?
Could this influence larger-scale future actions?

circumstances.name: Native American Religious or Cultural Sites
circumstances.description: May adversely affect properties listed or eligible for listing on the National Register of Historic Places, or may cause loss or destruction of significant scientific, cultural, or historical resources
screening_questions: Are there known cultural or religious sites?
Is the area eligible for National Register listing?
Has tribal consultation occurred?

circumstances.name: Highly Uncertain or Controversial Environmental Effects
circumstances.description: May have significant adverse effects on resources subject to management emphasis in Land Management Plans
screening_questions: Are environmental effects highly uncertain?
Is the action scientifically controversial?
Does it conflict with Land Management Plan direction?

circumstances.name: Cumulative Effects
circumstances.description: May have significant adverse cumulative effects
screening_questions: Are there other ongoing or planned actions in the area?
Could cumulative effects be significant?
Would this incrementally contribute to larger impacts?

process: For each EC, evaluate whether it applies to the proposed action
If any EC with 'triggers_ea: true' is triggered, CE pathway is not available
If other ECs are triggered, document in Decision Memo but may still use CE
Consult with specialists (biologists, archaeologists, etc.) as needed
documentation_requirements: Document screening for all ECs in project file
Include specialist input in screening determination
Provide rationale for why ECs do or do not apply
If ECs triggered, explain why EA or EIS is necessary
